Managed development team, day-to-day operations of the department, recruited new staff members, directed annual fundraising event and staffed board fundraising committee. Began new assignment as interim executive director in February, 2013 reporting to the board of directors: lead internal assessment for possible merger, day-to-day operations and financial management, management team, preparations for board annual meeting and fundraising processes and team.

recommendations: May 18, 2015, Linda was a client of Jeri’s

Jeri Royce is a gifted leadership trainer and coach.  She quickly set our management team up for success by providing just the right support at just the right time. Jeri has a natural, authentic style that connects easily with people.  She draws from her deep well of business expertise and personal experience to assess what is wrong, create a safe environment for learning and lead her client and their team gently through the rough spots.  I recommend Jeri to you as someone who will help you get your team and your organization back on track. Linda Volhein

summary: Linda Volhein is a nonprofit executive and respected community leader with over 25 years of success as a CEO, interim executive director, consultant, mentor, fundraiser, and organizational development coach. Linda began her career in 1993, as the executive director of Florence Crittenton, a small agency in decline with a compelling mission to provide hope, safety and opportunity to girls in crisis. Linda displayed the dedication and business acumen to execute an expansive, growth-oriented strategic vision and plan for Florence Crittenton that resulted in the development of a suite of critical new programs, a new, state-of-the art campus, innovative strategic alliances and the establishment of the Girls Leadership Academy of Arizona, the first single-gender public school in Arizona. After retiring from Florence Crittenton in 2011, Linda founded Volhein Consulting to apply the breadth and depth of her nonprofit experience. Her vision is to leave the world a better place by providing nonprofits with a suite of critical consulting services including interim executive leadership, counsel, assessment and change management. Linda recently serviced as the Interim Executive Director at Keogh Health Connection and Sojourner Center. She is currently serving as a consultant, mentor and group leader for St Luke’s Health Initiative and for the Administrative Office of the Court. Linda has been widely recognized as a community leader with numerous awards, including, Enterprising Woman Award, Woman of Distinction Award, Soroptomist Women Helping Women Award, ONE Executive Director of the Year and the YWCA Woman of the Year. Linda holds a Bachelor of Social Work degree from ASU along with graduate studies from the ASU College of Continuing Education on Nonprofit Management. Areas of Expertise include Interim Management, Organizational Assessment and Transition Planning, Comprehensive Fundraising Campaigns, Board Development, Leadership Coaching and Mentoring.
